snippet: Deacon Jones, part of the Los Angeles Rams’ Fearsome Foursome defense, put an indelible stamp on the N.F.L. in an era when everything was legal.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column remembers Deacon Jones, former pro football player who touched many lives inside and outside of football; says Jones was part of era in football in which everything was legal, from Horse-collar tackles to clothesline tackles and below-the-knees crackback blocks; notes Jones is credited with coining the term 'sack'.
lead_paragraph: Deacon Jones, part of the Los Angeles Rams’ Fearsome Foursome defense, put an indelible stamp on the N.F.L. in an era when everything was legal.

headline.seo: Deacon Jones’s Effect on Football Is Still Being Felt
headline.main: Deacon Jones’s Deep Impact on the N.F.L.
headline.print_headline: A Star of Football’s Violent Past
